intro.description: Check that you have understood the main concepts and techniques of GUIdancer

item.title: Project creation
item.description:
A Project is the container for AUT's and their configurations.
If you have multilingual AUT's, you can specify Project languages.

subitem.label: An AUT configuration contains details on how to start the AUT.
You can add different languages to your Project which are supported by your AUT. In this way you can easily test different versions of your AUT.
You choose the toolkit for your AUT when defining the AUT. The toolkit is the library used to create the AUT's GUI.

item.title: Test Cases
item.description: Test Cases are reusable modules, like keywords.

subitem.label: No programming is needed to create Test Cases.
Test Case creation can begin before you even have your application. The earlier you create tests, the more efficient your test process.
Test Cases can be added (via referencing) to other Test Cases. In this way, large and complex tests can be created from a small number of Test Cases.
The advantage of this is the flexibility of your tests. Tests are easy to maintain.
Data can be kept separate from the test flow, which also reduces maintenance effort.
By spending some time thinking about structuring your tests, you can save time and money while improving quality.
The value of test automation is in the stability of regression testing. GUIdancer lets you gain maximum benefit from regression tests, because maintenance efforts are so low.
